chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn P. Bauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shawn P. Bauer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shawn P. Bauer was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Pepin County Case No. 2015CF48.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs/surcharges according to a schedule as set forth by Probation & Parole.

Provide a DNA sample.
No possession or consumption of alcohol.
Comply with any assessment or counseling required by Probation & Parole.

timeConds.notes: Serve 60 days in the Pepin County Jail to commence May 15, 2016 at 6:00 p.m. with work release and up to 4 hours per week for child care services.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shawn P. Bauer in court with attorney Aaron Olson in 15CF48.  Defendant  Shawn P. Bauer in court with Attorney Joseph Randke in 15CF20.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel received PSI, no corrections.  State recommends 3 yrs probation, 6 mos. jail as condition of probation, consecutive jail sentence.  Atty Randke recommends 2-3 yrs. probation, conditional jail be stayed, if confinement ordered, ask huber and time with kids.  Atty Olson objects to conditional jail, probation appropriate.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 3 yrs. probation with conditions.  If revoked, 3 days sentence credit on meth. case.
Letter from S.S.
Letter from D.M.
Letter from MB regarding sentencing of Shawn Bauer.
NOH mailed to Shawn P. Bauer, 513 E Montgomery Street, Durand, WI 54736 ret'd to sender
Sentencing hearing on April 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Counts 2 & 3 Dismissed on Prosecutor's Motion.

Defendant Shawn P. Bauer in court with attorney Aaron Olson.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.  Defendant will plead to count 1 in 15CF20, count 1 & 2 in 15CF48 and count 3 will be DRI.  State w/draws motion to revoke bond & forfeit bail; PSI requested and proceed on OWI today.  Court advises defendant of count 1 in 15CF20, defendant pleads guilty; advised of charges of count 1 & 2 in 15CF48, defendant pleads guilty to each count.  Plea colloquy.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 in 15CF48, sentence to fine/costs of $1744.00; 65 days jail with credit for 3 days served; 48 hours w/o work release considered as part of 3 days already served; work release privileges; immediately report; revoke operating privileges for 24 mos.; AA & DSP; 12 mos. IID; IID on vehicle eff. 45 days from today;  PSI ordered on count 1 in 15CF20 & count 1 in 15CF48; referred to scheduling clerk for sentencing date @ 45 days out; Count 3 in 15CF48 DRI; all other counts and cases dismissed.
Status conference at 02-16-2016 02:30 pm
Status conference at 02-02-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant Shawn P. Bauer in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion filed for independtly testing samples.  Court notes there are 4 different cases, different violation dates.   Atty Randtke requests the testing include all those.   Court orders State to produce any items of physical evidence which intends to be introduced at trial as scientific evidence.  State to inform Mr. Randtke where those items are physically located and Mr. Randtke to make arrangements for testing and for transmittal of samples and method that preserves the chain of custody.  Referred to scheduling clerk to set STC on all cases.  If counsel needs an order for the crime lab, Atty Randtke to draft the order.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shawn P. Bauer in court with attorney Patrick William Waters of SPD Office.  Adam Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received the complaints on all 3 cases.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties, constitutional rights and right to preliminary hearings.  State requests $2500 cash bond based on criminal history.  Defendant informs court he resides with his parents at 513 E. Montgomery St., Durand.  Defendant previously resided at 715 11th Ave. E. Durand which he owned.  He's self-employed.  Court orders $1000 Sign. Bond with conditions:  no violations of law; appear for all court hearings.  Defendant waives time limits for P.H.  Atty Waters informs court this case will be assigned to other counsel.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No violation of law.
Appear for all Court appearances.
